alert.note: Alert for Monroe; St. Clair (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 14 at 5:56PM CDT until May 14 at 9:45PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: The National Weather Service in St Louis has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... North Central Monroe County in southwestern Illinois... Northern Saint Clair County in southwestern Illinois... South Central Saint Louis County in east central Missouri... Southern Saint Louis City in east central Missouri... * Until 945 PM CDT. * At 556 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 3 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... St. Louis, East St. Louis, East Carondelet, Cahokia, Swansea, Shiloh, Columbia, Mascoutah, Shrewsbury, Freeburg, Caseyville, Washington Park, Dupo, Millstadt, Madison, New Baden and Lakeshire. This includes the following State Parks... Scott Joplin Historic Site. This includes the following highways... Interstate 64 in Illinois between exits 9 and 27. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-3 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
